alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 2:33PM MST until August 23 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Mangum Fire scar in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 545 PM MST. * At 232 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Mangum Fire scar. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Mangum Fire scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Mangum Fire scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Warm Springs Canyon, Moquitch Canyon, Mangum Canyon, Big Springs Cabin Site, Big Springs Lookout Tower, Castle Canyon, Le Fevre Overlook and Riggs Canyon. This includes U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 583 and 605. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Kaibab Wash, Wildcat Canyon, Snake Gulch, Kanab Creek, Jumpup Canyon, Johnson Run, Sowats Canyon, Johnson Wash, Jacob Canyon and Warm Springs Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Flash flooding is occurring or imminent! Debris is expected to inundate Forest Service Roads 22 (Ryan Road) and 461. The Warm Springs Canyon water storage tank and pump house located along Forest Service Road 461 may also be affected. Flooding and debris may also affect the Big Springs Cabin Site and structures within Mangum Canyon.
